newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Budapest BUX hits record high for second day.
newsitem.headline: Budapest BUX hits record high for second day.

text.p: The Hungarian share market bucked a bearish trend on most European markets and extended Tuesday's gains to set the second successive new record.
The BUX index closed at 3,789.22 points, up 28.23, in active trade.
On the BUX futures market, which saw the four nearest maturities rise and the two longest fall, the December instrument gained 20 points to finish at 3,775.
"The (spot) market was strong again due to the strength of the dollar and to good macroeconomic results," said Balazs Bathory of Creditanstalt Securities.
"The market has also benefited from the fact that pressure on profit-taking, which drove prices lower a few weeks ago, has eased."
While almost all stocks closed higher, with some of them reaching all-time or 52-week record levels, French packaging company Cofinec plunged.
Cofinec GDRs plunged over 20 percent to 4,250 forints and following this deal trading was suspended for the rest of the day due to an unacceptably quick intraday fall.
Chemicals Borsodchem surged to a new high of 3,700 forints, before coming down a shade to close at 2,695, up 295.
The shares of Hungary's leading meat processor Pick jumped to a 52-week high of 8,550 forints, before closing at 8,505, up 400.

A trader said earlier today that there were bits of encouraging news about Pick and one important element was that Pick would probably have a better 1997 contract with its distributor in Germany, its main export market.
